nodes.bodyText:
This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                <string name="show_age_restricted_content_summary">Show content with an age limit (like 18+) and thus being probably unsafe for children.</string>
          
          
            
                <string name="show_age_restricted_content_summary">Show content suitable for ages 18 and above only.</string>
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -154,10 +154,11 @@
     <string name="popup_playing_append">Queued on popup player</string>
     <string name="c3s_url" translatable="false">https://www.c3s.cc/</string>
     <string name="content">Content</string>
-    <string name="show_age_restricted_content_title">Age restricted content</string>
-    <string name="video_is_age_restricted">Show age restricted video. Future changes are possible from the settings.</string>
-    <string name="youtube_restricted_mode_enabled_title">YouTube restricted mode</string>
-    <string name="restricted_video">This video is age restricted.\n\nTurn on \"Age restricted content\" in the settings if you want to see it.</string>
+    <string name="show_age_restricted_content_title">Show age restricted content</string>
+    <string name="show_age_restricted_content_summary">Show content with an age limit (like 18+) and thus being probably unsafe for children.</string>

nodes.bodyText: All content is suitable for ages 18 and above (i.e. the statement is ill-formed, as it is always true); Newpipe also restricts content 14+, 12+, 6+, ... (you name it, even though no service has such specific labels so far afaik); I wanted to talk about children safety just to be more clear, but this can indeed be removed.

nodes.bodyText:
This is flawed for two reasons

It suggests the material will be adjusted for the mental capacities of someone deemed to be at a mature level.
It suggests the same could be acquired by cutting material intended for immature audiences (it isn't(?)
By turning it off (I imagine it is on by default), the same happens. Is now content for mature audiences cut?

Intention is not a good guide for what actually happens, regardless of what actually happens.

nodes.bodyText:
I was going by the idea that this sort of terminology is already used when classifying content for various audiences.
ESRB has a Mature category, for example. And I'm sure you must have seen the quote "The following is intended only for mature audiences. Viewer discretion advised. " several times.

nodes.bodyText:
@opusforlife2 "And above only" is not the same statement as "Show content only suitable __", because if it was it wouldn't be English. Insofar that it isn't, you already pointed out it means a limitation to 18+ content. Similarly, "Only show content __" is a valid statement that means a limitation to 18+ content, but now in functional English.
Still confused as to what the ambiguity is.

nodes.bodyText:
When I say a user might get confused, I'm thinking of users for whom English is not the first language, but they still use the app in English. They might find it difficult to tell if that "only" applies to "show content" or to "ages 18 and above". Putting the "only" on either side would reduce chances of that confusion.
Anyway, I suggested another way to phrase it, above. Check it out.

nodes.bodyText:
Only→suitable for, suitable for→ ages 18 and above
It isn't the simplest sentence, and quite possibly not the simplest sentence possible.
Ruining the actual content for people that speak English, in their own language, is not really why there are translations, or what should be done. Will reply.
